AVSEC Order No. 11/2011  
Subject:- 
Regulated Agent Cargo Security Programme 
 
In continuation  of this  Bureau AVSEC Order  No. 1/2009 dated 
12.01.2009  on the  subject cited above and in exercise of powers conferred by 
Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934, delegated to him vide Government of India, 
Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 1797, dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner 
of Security (Civil Aviation), Bureau of Civil Aviation Security for the purpose of 
securing the aircraft   operations  directs that: 
(i) 
Each Regulated Agent shall  appoint, under intimation to the  COSCA, a  
Chief Security Officer who  shall be  responsible for  the aviation security 
oversight of Regulated Agent. 
 
 (ii) 
The Regulated Agent’s Security Programme   shall be regularly updated 
based  on instructions issued  by the  BCAS from time to time .  
 
(iii) 
The Security Programme shall be  valid for  3 (Three) years only. 
Thereafter,  the revised  Security Programme  shall be resubmitted  by the 
concerned agency for approval of  COSCA. 
 
2. 
The  above instructions  shall be  implemented  with immediate  effect. 
Any violation of  this AVSEC Order  shall  attract  penalty  under section 11A of  
the Aircraft Act, 1934. 
 
 
 
(Gurjot Singh Malhi, IPS)   
Commissioner of  Security  (CA)
